newsitem.title: UK: United, utilities resilient to market trend.
newsitem.headline: United, utilities resilient to market trend.

text.p: Utility stocks showed some resilience to overall London stock market falls on Tuesday with United Utilities bucking the trend to be the only gainer on the FT-SE 100 as they appeared a defensive play for the market, analysts said.
"We've seen some buyers this morning and people with small books are covering their tracks," one trader said.
United Utilities was up two pence at 0900 GMT to 630 pence with Scottish Power unchanged at 353-1/2 pence as the overall market fell 2.21 percent.
Scottish Hydro was up two pence to 363 pence while generator National Grid had edged down three pence to 206-1/2 pence.
The utilities were also being seen as a relatively defensive play in a sliding market, analysts said, helping to trim losses.
"National Grid, for example, is quite a defensive stock and so it is not expected to move too far," one analyst said.

In addition, this analyst said, there could be hopes that the two Scottish firms might escape more lightly than their English counterparts from a proposed windfall tax from the opposition Labour party.
Labour, well ahead of the ruling Conservative party in polls ahead of a May 1 election, has vowed to levy a one-off tax on privatised companies if it wins power.
"There is some hope that the Scottish companies might get away with the windfall tax better," the analyst said.
